ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Unique identifier of cells
A controlled vocabulary describing the cell type
Notes: 1=astrocyte; 2=B-lymphocyte; 3=CD138(plus) cell; 4=CD8(plus) T-cell; 5=cultured neuronal cell from olfactory neuroepithelium (CNON); 6=dopaminergic neuron; 7=epithelial; 8=epithelial-like; 9=GABAergic neuron; 10=glia; 11=glial progenitor cell; 12=glutamatergic neuron; 13=hematopoetic; 14=immune cell; 15=lymphoblast; 16=macrophage; 17=mesenchymal cell; 18=microglia; 19=monocyte; 20=monocyte-derived microglia; 21=NeuN-; 22=NeuN(plus); 23=neural stem cell; 24=neuronal-intermediate progenitor cell; 25=oligodendrocyte; 26=peripheral blood mononuclear cell; 27=radial glia cell; -99=Other

ElementDescription: Other specific cell type not listed
Subtype of cell type specifying more detail of cell type morphology
Describe the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type
Describe the growth properties of the primary cell or cell line (e.g. adherent; suspension)
A description of the culture conditions that were used and are suitable for this type of cell
Cell culture substrate
Cell culture media
Cell passage number
Passage method
Passage reagent
Have cells been karyotyped?
Is karyotype consistent with the expected genetic state of the cells?
Passage number since last karyotyping was performed
The passage number since the last karyotyping
Karyotype of cell using International System for Human Cytogenetic Nomenclature
If cells used have already been deposited in a biorepository and have an ID number
Name of database with cells
Name of other cell database
ID of cells in database
